utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Buh-bye. I just got us reservations at Michelle’s and tickets to the Musicman to celebrate our first holiday season as a betroughed couple.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Betrothed…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: …betrothed couple.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel and Monica
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Haaaa... ... ahhhh!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Pheebs?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Skull?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, it's my mom's.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my god!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, no, no. It's not! It's not my mom. It belonged to mom. Yeah, no, she used to put it out every Christmas to remind us, that even though it's Christmas, people still die. And, you can put candy in it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Licorice?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sure! Hey, I just found out, I get Ben for the holidays this year.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Ohh! That's great!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are you gonna dress up as Santa?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Nope. I mean, I know Susan does every year, but I think I wanna take this year to teach him all about Hanukkah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: And maybe I could teach Ben about the Christmas skull and how people die.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You may need to use this year to teach Ben about Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Did you know he was in there?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How long have we been home?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: About a half an hour.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Lovely!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, you know what I was thinking? When we get married, are you gonna change your last name to Bing?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Bing's weird.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, hey, you guys!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey. Guess what! My landlord just called and my apartment is gonna get ready soon, so I guess I'll be moving out.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ahh, Phoebe, I'm gonna miss you!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes, you will be very sad. All right, well I gotta go tell Rachel the good news.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ohh! You guys gonna be living together again?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, why not?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, she's just so much fun with Joey, I just assumed, she'd still be living with him.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why do you think, she's having so much fun living with Joey?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No reason, except…she…told…me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Really? So she said, she didn’t wanna live with me anymore?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No! No, she didn't say that. I-I-I think you should talk to Monica now.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe, don't worry about it. I'm sure she wants to live with you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You're sure? You're absolutely sure?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, no. But, um, I bet she probably does.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Probably? Yeah, I don't like that word. Kind of what ‘probably’ really means. Yeah, uh-huh. Yeah, oh, "Your mom probably won't kill herself," y’know? I'm sorry, but I'm not hanging all my hopes of Rachel and I living together on-on "Probably!" Y’know? You gotta take care of yourselves! In this world history teaches us nothing!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Bing doesn't seem so weird now, does it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! Great, you’re home! Guess what Phoebe got me for Christmas!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Drums?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No! Drums!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi, could we get two burritos to go, please?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'm sorry. But not that sorry, 'cause you don't have to live with it. Um, we have a reservation under the name Chandler Bing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Forty-five minutes? We have tickets to the Musicman at 8:00.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Is this because of the burrito thing?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You need to give him money.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Give him money? It was a joke!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, to get a table! Places like are always shakin’ you down. Everybody wants to be paid off.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Right, calm down, O'Mally. I'll slip him some money.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You've got to be smooth about it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, I can be smooth. Listen, we're a little bit in a hurry, so, if you can get us a table a little quicker, I'd appreciate it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How did it go?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Had the money in the wrong hand.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wooooooo, hehehe. Hey, ahh, you don't feel like you're gonna throw up, do ya?

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I do, so let's... So, Ben, you uh, you know what holiday is coming up, don't ya?

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Christmas.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yep, and you know what other holiday is coming up?

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Christmas eve.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes, but also Hanukkah! See, you're part Jewish, and-and Hanukkah is a Jewish holiday.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Santa has reindeers that can fly!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Right, um, but, on Hanukkah, Hanukkah is a celebration of a miracle. See, years and years ago there were these people called the Maccabees.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Jingle bells, jingle bells...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, that's right, yes, but on Hanukkah, uh, we sing, uh Dreidel, dreidel, dreidel, I made you out of clay.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Rudolph, the red-nosed reindeer...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, it's not a contest.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: When is Santa coming?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, how about this year, instead of Santa, we have fun celebrating Hanukkah?

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: No Santa? Was I bad?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No! Oh, no-no-no. Hey, you weren't bad, you've been very good, Ben.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Santa's mad at me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, hey-hey, come on, Ben, Santa is not mad at you, okay? Hey, you're-you're his favorite little guy!

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: So Santa's coming?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes! Santa's coming!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It's easy! Just keep it casual! Give him a kind word, shake his hand and give him the money!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How do you know so much about this?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Richard used to do it, didn't he?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We'd be eating our soup right now.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Mustached bastard…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, those people just left, come on! Quick! Give him the money and get their table!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Excuse me...

utterance.speaker: Male Guest
utterance.content: Good evening.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ahh-hahaha!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ha!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So you like the drums! That's, that's great! Y’know, I was worried, that, you know, they would maybe an unbearable living situation. All right, okay, well, apparently not! So, yay!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey-hey, Pheebs, check it out, we already learned a song. Ready? One, two, three, four...

utterance.speaker: Rachel and Joey
utterance.content: Tequila!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That's fun.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thank you Gunther, put it there. Definitely not easier with coins. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thank you. Hey Pheebs!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Here. Now I only owe you $49.50.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey Pheebs!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: If you wanna give Joey a Christmas present that disrupts the entire building, why not get him something a little bit more subtle, like a wrecking ball, or a vile of small pox to release in the hallway?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It's not just the drum noise. Every five minutes, Joey throws his sticks in the air, and I have to hear, "Oh my eye! Oh god, my eye!" I mean, it is so annoying.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes, thank you. You see, this is how normal people are supposed to react to drums.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe, you got Joey drums to annoy Rachel, so she wouldn't wanna live there anymore?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Maybe on some level.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, y’know that you could just not throw the sticks up in the air.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What is Rock 'n' Roll about that?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, Joey, I got you another present.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh wait, before you tell me what it is! Okay, what is it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It's a…tarantula! Oh! God! Rachel, look, I'm sorry. What was I thinking giving Joey this big, gross, scary spider in such a poorly constructed cage?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What are you talking about? I love them! Yeah, I had a tarantula when I was a kid. But it-it died, because my cat ate it. And then, then my cat died. But Joey, isn't this cool?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Is it on me? I feel, I feel like it's on me! I got, hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, isn't that adorable? Joey is afraid of the tarantula.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ah, yeah, he's so adorable, God, he's just so much fun, Joey is the best, I'm glad you're having so much fun here.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? Wait-wait a minute, what? Phoebe, what's the matter?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Our apartment is ready.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And that makes you angry because…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Because you would rather live here with Joey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Where did you get that?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Monica and Chandler said that you were having so much fun here. And apparently no amount of drums or tarantulas is gonna change that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Phoebe?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hm?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Did you get all this stuff for Joey to try and drive me out of the apartment? Honey, if you wanted to do that, you might as well just gotten him a fish, you know how fish freaked me out!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Fish!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It wouldn't have mattered anyway, Phoebe, you and I are, are gonna live together, we're roommates; that's the deal.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes, but I wanted you to want to live with me, but okay, if you're having so much fun over here…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, it's so much more fun with you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: We did have fun, didn't we?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We did!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, anyway, they say, if we want, we can see it tonight.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I would love to!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yay, okay!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Good, good, good, good, good.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Great, all right, okay, and Monica ask me to make the drumming stop.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Um... Done!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Salesman
utterance.content: Hello, Sir. You're here to return those pants?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, these are my pants.

utterance.speaker: Salesman
utterance.content: Oh. Okay! How can I help you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, uh, do you have a Santa-outfit left?

utterance.speaker: Salesman
utterance.content: Two days before Christmas? Sorry, man.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay look, do-do, you have anything Christmassy? I promised my son, and I really don't want to disappoint him, um, come on, I…uh, you gotta have something.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm the holiday armadillo! I'm a friend of Santa's and he sent me here to wish you a Merry Christmas!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What happened to Santa, Holiday Armadillo?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Santa was unavailable so close to Christmas.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow, come in, have a seat. You must be exhausted coming all the way from…Texas.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Texas?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That's right, Ben. I'm Santa's representative for all the southern states. And Mexico! But, Santa sent me here to give you these presents, Ben. Maybe the Lady will help me with these presents.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Wow! Thanks!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You're welcome, Ben. Merry Christmas, ooh, and Happy Hanukkah!

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Are you for Hanukkah, too? Because I'm part-Jewish.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You are? Me, too!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Because Armadillos also wandered in the desert?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You wanna wander in the hall? Ooh, hey Ben, what if the Holiday Armadillo told you all about the festival of lights?

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Cool!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Come on Ben.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Years and years ago there were these people called the Maccabees...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ho, ho, ho! Merry Christmas!

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Santa!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What are you doing here, Santa?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I'm here to see my old buddy Ben. What are you doing here, weird…turtle-man?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm the Holiday Armadillo, your part-Jewish friend. You sent me here to give Ben some presents. Remember?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Did you bring me any presents, Santa?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You bet I did, Ben, put it there! Well, it would have worked this time, if his hands weren't so damn small! Ho, ho, ho!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay Ben, why don't you come open some more presents, and Santa, the Armadillo, and I have a little talk in the kitchen? There's a sentence, I never thought I'd say.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You called everyone and said you were having trouble finding a Santa costume, so I borrowed one from a guy at work!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thank you, but, but you gotta leave.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Because, I'm finally getting him excited about Hanukkah, and, and you're-you’re wrecking it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: But I didn't get to shape my belly like a bowl full of jelly.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm sorry, Chandler but this, this is really important to me.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Fine, I'll give the suit back.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, you think, you can keep it another night?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Santa? Really?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes, is that okay?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Did your Dad ever dress up like Santa?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Then it's okay!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay Ben, Santa has to go. Say good-bye!

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: No! Why does he have to go?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because, if Santa and the Holiday…Armadillo? ...are ever in the same room for too long the universe will implode. Merry Christmas!

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: No! Why can't the Armadillo leave? I want Santa!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Fine, I-I give up. Santa, Santa can stay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I'll stay, but only because I wanna hear about Hanukkah. Ben, will you sit here with Santa and learn about Hanukkah?

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Okay, Santa!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right, it's time for the story of Hanukkah. Years and years ago, there were these people called the Maccabees.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Merry Christmas!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh wow! Look at this place!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, this is terrible. Oh, they’ve made so many changes I can’t even feel my grandmother’s presence anymore—Ooh! New sconces!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, remember uh, remember how you told me that your grandmother put up that wall to make that into two bedrooms?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And remember how you always said you were afraid the landlord would find out and then tear it down?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Do you really not know where I’m going with this? It left! It’s one huge room!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no! Oh! Wow!!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: See?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I guess we’ll just have to put the wall back up.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You can’t, because of the new skylight!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: There’s a skylight?! Wow!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So what should we do? Should we start looking for a new place?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Y’know I’m-I’m sensing that um, my grandmother would not be comfortable with that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah? Startin’ to feel her again there are we?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: A little bit, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Pheebs is your grandmother maybe saying that you should live here alone?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You heard her too?! You have the gift!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Phoebe, it’s okay. I like living with Joey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh please, I hate packing, it’s closer to work, and we do have fun. Although, I’m really gonna miss living with you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh me too.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know. Oh-oh, wait did you hear that-hear that? Listen, I’m gettin’ something from your grandmother, she said that since you get to keep the one bedroom apartment you should give Rachel the purple chair?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, I do not hear that.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: …and the miracle was that that little bit of oil that should’ve just lasted just one day, burned for…

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Eight whole days.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s right, and that’s why we celebrate Hanukkah today. The end.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Awesome!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: My favorite part was when Superman flew all the Jews out of Egypt.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The Armadillo was actually not so thrilled about that part! Okay Ben, it’s time to light the Hanukkah candles!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! It looks like the Easter Bunny’s funeral in here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on, come on, we’re-we’re-we’re lighting the candles!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I understand why Superman is here, but why is there a porcupine at the Easter Bunny’s funeral?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I got it!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Is it back in the cage?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Its back in cage!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Cage closed?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, would you just come out here and stop being such a baby!
